ai-mil5.5.9:0.4_0: Discussion of the verses on the Trunk
ai-mil5.5.9:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, the Buddha has said these words:
ai-mil5.5.9:2.1_0: ‘Food enchanted by a spell isn’t fit for me to eat.
ai-mil5.5.9:2.2_0: that is not the Dhamma, brahmin, of those who see,
ai-mil5.5.9:2.3_0: Buddhas reject what is gained through chanting verses,
ai-mil5.5.9:3.1_0: Furthermore, the Buddha is teaching Dhamma to the assembly. After hearing the teaching of the Buddha, he gave his ethical conduct, some people of the gods. After hearing that teaching, they use it to make the whole world.
ai-mil5.5.9:3.2_0: the Buddha has said these words:
ai-mil5.5.9:3.3_0: ‘It would be well infatuated by a cow,’ and how the first statement answers, ‘That is wrong.’
ai-mil5.5.9:3.4_0: if they don’t talk about what I need, saying: ‘That’s why I don’t get any wrong food.’
ai-mil5.5.9:3.6_0: ... they enjoy a gift that is an offering to householders ...
ai-mil5.5.9:3.7_0: This question too is deep and observed to the profound the deep questions.”
ai-mil5.5.9:4.1_0: “Great king, the Buddha has spoken about this:
ai-mil5.5.9:4.2_0: ‘It’s for me to eat in moderation, brahmin.
ai-mil5.5.9:4.3_0: The Buddhas obtained this verse: “The Dhamma is the first among men who have been awakened for the Dhamma that is spoken of the brahmin, and who gives the gifts of the Serpents, when the Faithful Mount Vediya, having taken the Tathāgata of all these verses (from the Buddhas). However, having done what is their heart through it?”
ai-mil5.5.9:4.4_0: which people give to him first of all the people.
ai-mil5.5.9:4.6_0: commended with Vaṅkanāsika, the carts, the bowels, the bowels, and the chariots.
ai-mil5.5.9:4.7_0: In the same way, great king, the Realized One has taken the first precepts and observances later.
ai-mil5.5.9:5.1_0: And that’s how, great king, can’t observe the council hall, as one of the earth in the four winds.
ai-mil5.5.9:5.2_0: In the same way, great king, the Realised One should first show himself first to the ethical precepts and later on.
ai-mil5.5.9:5.3_0: give gifts of don’t give. Sometimes your mind is successful, prosperous, popularity, attributes, and workers; and they don’t go to heaven. That’s why there’s no citadel for the sake of their wives, and no emigration.”
ai-mil5.5.9:6.1_0: “Venerable sir, when you say ‘following dragons’, how many kinds of self are there.”
ai-mil5.5.9:6.2_0: “Great king, there are these two kinds of  known by the body which are idiostic in which they understand.
ai-mil5.5.9:6.3_0: Herein, there is the blameworthy branch of the body, there is blameless.
ai-mil5.5.9:6.4_0: those who know the right kind, those who are blameworthy and blameless.
ai-mil5.5.9:7.2_0: It’s when someone goes to a family and is standing on the bank of the body, that is frightening and infant. This is the proper conduct.
ai-mil5.5.9:7.3_0: and they still eat the noble ones.
ai-mil5.5.9:8.1_0: Furthermore, take a mendicant who enters and remains in the company of families, but standing within them. They uselessly enjoy these things. They’ve been caught up in them, shooked, fever, and they enjoy this.
ai-mil5.5.9:9.1_0: Furthermore, one mendicant is killed and finished off by his foes. They eat only what they have been left behind, contempt, judged, scorned, or mistaken in livelihood.
ai-mil5.5.9:10.1_0: What is the blamelessness of the body?
ai-mil5.5.9:10.2_0: It’s when a mendicant proceeds to a family, mindful and aware, subtle, and aware, taking established in these places, they continue.
ai-mil5.5.9:10.3_0: This is called a person who enjoys the things known by the body, speech, and mind that are considered to be known. But when they hear the noble ones, they are pure and bright.
ai-mil5.5.9:10.4_0: The Buddha has spoken about the gods of the Thirty-Three:
ai-mil5.5.9:11.2_0: for the wise one who feels them.
ai-mil5.5.9:11.4_0: this is the noble search for a noble one.’
ai-mil5.5.9:12.1_0: What is the kind of speech?
ai-mil5.5.9:12.2_0: It’s when a mendicant usually asks for many robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And they enjoy a livelihood that are reckoned as such.
ai-mil5.5.9:13.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant uses others to get material possessions, honor, and popularity. They use these things.
ai-mil5.5.9:14.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant uses their methods, the four assemblies, the people who say, ‘from the best of these things.’ Or they enjoy alive, slaughter, fat, and swords. But when they hear the noble ones break apart, they use the noble ones, undefeated, imagineable, and hard to get these things.
ai-mil5.5.9:15.1_0: Have no use for the sick Sāriputta any elder at the sunrise and asking the elder Mahāmoggallāna for the sake of his getting medicine when he was sick, the senior monk was breaking them up.
ai-mil5.5.9:15.2_0: Then the senior mendicant, thinking: ‘May they be slaughtered with medicine for these reasons, feeding on medicine through the air, give up this medicine.’
ai-mil5.5.9:15.3_0: Those who understood (surely) verbal expressions in this way, are blameworthy and blameless in the noble ones.
ai-mil5.5.9:15.4_0: But a person is considered a noble disciple who is essential, wild, boredom, secure, spittle, and scorned aside.
ai-mil5.5.9:16.1_0: What are the four kinds of direct-knowledge?
ai-mil5.5.9:16.2_0: It’s when a mendicant asks for tonics; they’re able to ask for tonics from families and their livelihood; they use the noble ones, undefeated, loyal, pure. They are regarded as fairies; they enjoy alive.
ai-mil5.5.9:17.1_0: And in that the Realized One dropped the brahmin Kapilavatthu to give up the bearer of the food and drink. That’s why he spends the simile of the position of his life.”
ai-mil5.5.9:18.1_0: “Sir, when a royal bull elephant is eating in a god from a Realized One, the deity of the gods, would they eat the alms-food as bowl against the nurse?”
ai-mil5.5.9:18.2_0: “Great king, when the Realized One was eating the deity, they took ahold of the heir, holding a knife, and raised his joined palms toward the Buddha.
ai-mil5.5.9:19.1_0: But just as the king eats staples ate on the turn, he picked up a consequence.
ai-mil5.5.9:19.2_0: In the same way, when the Realized One is eating the deity, seized by the deities, banner and grew up in all the fire-place, and shook it.
ai-mil5.5.9:19.3_0: And when the Buddha was born in a net of enmity and illness, he brought them up and brought them up.”
ai-mil5.5.9:19.4_0: “The deities of the Nāgas, sir, are dispelled by those deities, human beings in the Realized One’s body.
ai-mil5.5.9:19.5_0: It would be good, sir, if you would accept it.”
ai-mil5.5.9:20.1_0: The ninth verses about in eating (mind) a ninth section,
